column5: Anyone spend any time fishing Bray Lake in Lac Seul? Heading up this week and we're fishing Bray for the first time and I was wondering where to concentrate.........thanks for the help.
I need to look at my maps, where is Bray lake?
West of Mahkwa Lodge and south of Chambers Island.

Bray is a great place for some deep water Bottom Bouncing this time of year. Locate the edges of the structure in the center of the lake and fish them hard. Also the north shore deep water is a good spot.
ThanksStill need to look at my maps!

Bray Lake was everything you said it was Mike. It was actually a special place to fish. The serentiy and relaxed environmnet made it a geat couple of days of fishing...................not to mention we fished deeper, about 40-45 ft where the water temps were about three degrees cooler....63 and in the 2 1/2 days our over the slot total was up in the high 50's but nothing over 25inches. Just had a ball and figured it out in a couple of hours..........................thanks
Glad you had a great trip. Hope all is well with you and yours and you have a great winter. Mike Kansas
